span.p: We have a coaxial magnet and a ring which are both movable along their common axis. To move the magnet or ring, left click on and drag the one you want to move. The ring has a self-inductance and a resistance. You can change the magnetic dipole moment of the magnet and the resistance of the ring using the sliders below the view window. The top graph to the right shows the external magnetic flux through the ring (i.e. that due only to the magnet) versus time as a red line. The total magnetic flux (i.e. that due to current in the ring plus that due to the magnet) is shown as a blue line. The lower graph on the right shows the induced (eddy) current in the ring. The simulation is running when first opened (i.e. fluxes and currents versus time are being plotted). Hit "Pause" to stop the displays. They will restart automatically when you move the ring or magnet. Use "Reset Simulation" to get the time reset to 0.

If you want to have the magnet move sinusoidally in and out of the ring automatically, click the "Motion on" button. To return to user control, click the button again. During the motion, you can use the "Pause" and "Resume" buttons to freeze a particular configuration.
Left clicking and holding while moving the cursor anyplace other than on the ring or magnet will change the view orientation. Use the "Reset Camera" button to get back to the original view angle.

You can increase or decrease the number of field lines shown using the bottom slider. At any point with motion halted (either automatic or manual), you can toggle between field lines and iron filings representations. Note that the iron filings view takes some time to calculate and render.
(Please be patient - the simulation may take ~20 seconds to load)
